rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifying a risk-adjective.
statement_text: The acting chief executive of the Australian Chicken Growers Council, Dr Joanne Sillince, said any egg supply issues were a 'short-term blip that will resolve itself very quickly.' 'You have got a whole bunch of new pullets coming into production every week,' she [Dr Joanne Sillince] said, referring to young hens.

rationale: The segment uses reassuring language ('short-term blip that will resolve itself very quickly') and factual language ('said', 'referring to') and does not contain a high-potency verb, potent metaphor, superlative + negative noun, or critical alert phrase.
